intro: Salvia ariana, commonly known as the Armenian sage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces vibrant purple to blue flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Salvia ariana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or arid landscapes.
